title: Captain Kuro's Potential Return
theoryText: Some fans speculate that Captain Kuro, despite his apparent retirement from piracy, could return later in the series. His intelligence, strategic mind, and unique fighting style make him a memorable early antagonist. Fans theorize he might have connections to larger criminal organizations or could become relevant during arcs involving the Marines or underworld figures.
author: One Piece Fan Community

title: Jango's Hypnosis Limits and Potential
theoryText: Episode 13 showcases both the power and limitations of Jango's hypnosis when he accidentally enhances Luffy. Fans have theorized about the upper limits of his ability - could he hypnotize truly powerful individuals? Could he hypnotize someone to unlock latent Devil Fruit abilities? The accidental hypnosis of Luffy in this episode suggests his power could be much more significant if used strategically.
author: One Piece Theory Community

title: The Nyaban Brothers' Fighting Style Influence
theoryText: The debut of the Nyaban Brothers in episode 13 introduced the concept of coordinated duo combat to the series. Fans have discussed whether this fighting style influenced later team battles and whether the brothers' cat-themed martial arts had deeper roots in the One Piece world's fighting traditions.
author: Combat Analysis Fans

title: Kuro's Intelligence Network
theoryText: Kuro's elaborate three-year plan to infiltrate Kaya's household suggests impressive intelligence-gathering capabilities. Fans theorize that Kuro may have had connections to information brokers or underworld networks that were never fully explored. His ability to seal Usopp's secret entrance and anticipate defensive measures shows thorough reconnaissance.
author: Plot Analysis Community
